TopicTitle: [In progress] Duneshot 7 - Mobile Command Vehicle/Operations Centre

Articles.Content:
The Mobile Command Vehicle [also known as the Mobile Operations Centre] is a large rover capable of carring eight Kerbals [the current population of the Southern Duna Anomaly Research Site is 12] and speeds of up to 23.8m/s on Kerbin. It has its own thread in the Spacecraft Exchange here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/36599-Mobile-Operations-Centre

For Duneshot 7, we will be sending a multiple Kerbal mobile research platform and command vehicle, the Goddard Intrepid T-50, atop the Veto Aerospace Echo Light stack. The Echo Light is intended for payloads which will not weight heavily on the stack. Echo Standard launchers have been known to destroy themselves from the core stage being too overpowered for small payloads near or during booster seperation. This will be fitted with a Duna landing stage in orbit, one fitted with parachutes and retro thrusters, so that there will be no risk of parachutes ripping pieces from the vehicle itself when they open. Behind the landing stage, there will be one or more Jumbo-64 tanked interplanetary stages. Likely these stages will become new fuel storage sections for the spacestation in low Duna orbit.

To be continued.

Edited June 19, 2013 by RedDwarfIV
That is an awesome looking project you got going there... Great work.

My oddest looking rocket ever.

This is the Duna landing stage. It comes equipped with 12 side parachutes, 12 drogue parachutes, and two main parachutes, as well as six sets of small retro thrusters to ease landing. It is meant to use part of the interplanetary stage to slow for parachute speed.

I managed to get this into a highly elliptical orbit before losing electrical power.

Unfortunately, I discovered this upon docking:

I will be sending up a new MOCV with a more projected and ejectable docking port.

Edited June 21, 2013 by RedDwarfIV

Finally got 'em docked.

Now comes docking the interplanetary stage before waiting for transfer window.
